job_description:
About Quantum Bridge
Quantum Bridge (QBT) is a Canadian startup, specializing in delivering a scalable system for symmetric key distribution to enable quantum-safe encryption for everyone. We are a team of experts in our field, passionate about pushing the boundaries of what is possible, and always looking for talented individuals to join us in our mission.

To succeed at Quantum Bridge, you must embrace our start-up nature, have an entrepreneurial mindset, and be committed to supporting and enabling a team with ambitious goals to revolutionize the way that the world generates, processes, exchanges, and secures data.

Quantum Bridge has a fast-paced environment. We are on track to grow over the next few years and to take a leading position in the global market for key distribution and quantum-safe encryption. With that, we've outlined the duties of this role below and want to highlight that we offer competitive compensation (including Stock Options), benefits, perks, rapid career advancement and growth opportunities, and much more (details below).

If this opportunity sounds like a great fit for you, we encourage you to apply!

About the role
The Lead Software Engineer will be an integral part of the Engineering team, responsible for a wide range of hands-on software engineering duties, including software development, delivery, and maintenance of the Distributed Symmetric Key Exchange (DSKE) client and server software. The DSKE client is delivered as a software development kit (SDK) that allows integration into a variety of systems. QBT also supports a Key Management Entity (KME) product that incorporates the SDK and integrates with existing network appliances. The software is written in Rust.

The individual should be a builder and have experience working in a startup environment. The ability to collaborate and approach problems hands-on is essential for this role. The Lead Software Engineer should also have experience leading and mentoring teams. Ample growth opportunities will be provided in your role and as the organization grows over time.

This position is based out of Toronto, Ontario and is primarily hybrid. Remote work options are available but in-person work may be required from time to time.

Your day-to-day responsibilities will include, but are not limited to, the following:
Contribute to the development of our core software stack using Rust
Be a collaborative and transparent team member
Be a key contributor to the software architecture and design
To be technically hands-on and dive into coding, troubleshooting and debugging, and developing automated solutions
Manage a growing team of engineers and direct reports by providing hands-on coaching, training, and mentoring
Lead individual project priorities and deadlines as well as provide feedback on other projects and team milestones
Work through the phases of discovery, requirements, architecture, specification, design, implementation, and deployment on projects
Participate in testing new products and features and develop procedures

You will bring:
Degree in Software Engineering, Computer Science, similar technical field of study, or equivalent practical experience
7+ years of experience as a back-end software engineer with DevOps experience
5+ years experience in Linux
3+ years of experience leading and mentoring a technical team
Commitment and accountability for quality, technical excellence, and results including managing projects from inception through completion
Curiosity and enthusiasm to learn, experiment, and deliver innovative solutions
Experience working in a startup environment
Extensive experience with systems-level software and languages and back-end development
Solid understanding of software architecture and systems-level engineering
Experience with distributed systems and databases
Experience with communication protocols (TCP/IP, UDP, etc.)
Great communication skills, both written and verbal
Excellent presentation skills to a variety of stakeholders, both internal and external
A strong understanding and experience with security is crucial

What we offer:
Quantum Bridge offers a close-knit environment with competitive pay and perks, including:
Competitive base salary and conditional option to purchase Common Shares which can hold significant value
Generous vacation (4 weeks) and time-off
Health benefits package
Growth and development opportunities. We believe in promoting from within!
Working 1-1 with the CEO and executive team, as well as industry leaders

This is a fast-paced environment. We are on track to grow over the next few years and to take a leading position in the global market for key distribution and quantum-safe encryption.

We believe in embracing potential. Even if you do not have the exact experience we're looking for, if you know you've got what it takes, we want to hear from you! Tell us more in your application and cover letter.

Quantum Bridge is an equal opportunity employer and is dedicated to fostering an inclusive and barrier-free work environment for all employees and candidates. We encourage all qualified candidates to apply and if accommodation is required during any stage of the recruitment process, please contact us. We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only those selected for interviews will be contacted.
